metadata.title: CVE-2022-31813 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Apache HTTP Server 2.4.53 and earlier may not send the X-Forwarded-*headers to the origin server based on client side Connection headerhop-by-hop mechanism. This may be used to bypass IP based authentication onthe origin server/application.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-31813` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.17+esm6
apache2-bin - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.17+esm6
apache2-data - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.17+esm6
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.17+esm6
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.17+esm6
apache2-utils - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.17+esm6
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: apache2 package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.18-2ubuntu3.17+esm6').
